meanings.sent1: By incommoding others, you make them feel uncomfortable.
meanings.sent2: Please stop incommoding me while I am trying to work.
meanings.sent3: Incommoding your friend by talking loudly during a movie is not polite.
meanings.sent4: The noisy construction work was incommoding the entire neighborhood.
meanings.sent5: The bright lights incommoded her sensitive eyes.

meanings.sent1: The loud music incommoded the neighbors late at night.
meanings.sent2: I hope I am not incommoding you by asking for a favor.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat enjoys incommoding the dog by stealing its toys.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected rain incommoded our plans for a picnic.
meanings.sent5: The broken elevator incommoded the residents of the building.
